conclusion: Analyze paths of liquid from A, B, and C to determine which container it ends up in.
Liquid from point A flows downward.
Liquid from point A encounters a yellow baffle directing it left.
Liquid from point A hits another baffle redirecting it further left.
Liquid from point A reaches bottom-left corner and flows into container D.
Liquid from point B flows downward.
Liquid from point B encounters a blue baffle directing it right.
Liquid from point B hits another baffle redirecting it further right.
Liquid from point B reaches bottom-right corner and flows into container E.
Liquid from point C flows downward.
Liquid from point C encounters an orange baffle directing it left.
Liquid from point C hits a grey baffle redirecting it further left.
Liquid from point C reaches bottom-left corner and flows into container D.
Liquid from A flows into container D, liquid from B flows into container E, liquid from C flows into container D.
Final answer: Liquid from A and C ends up in container D, liquid from B ends up in container E.
